Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the database.
Design the database architecture, including the number of servers, storage requirements, and high availability configurations.
Choose the appropriate pricing tier based on the performance and scalability requirements.
Create and configure the Azure Database for MariaDB instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell.
Set up firewall rules to allow access to the database from specific IP addresses or Azure services.
Enable SSL enforcement for secure connections and configure user roles and permissions for database access.
Set up automated backups and define retention policies to ensure data recovery in case of failure.
Optimize database performance by configuring query performance insights and adjusting server parameters as needed.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track database health, performance, and usage metrics.
Verify that the database is accessible from the intended applications and services. Test failover scenarios if high availability is configured.
Document the database setup, configurations, and operational procedures. Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the database.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
